version.comment: Public Comment Release Root Zone LGR

meta.description:
Label Generation Rules for the Root Zone — LGR-3

Note: this merged file is intended to be used for testing a label for conflicts with existing labels irrespective of their script. However, it can neither be used to conclusively establish the validity of any label nor to generate the set of allocatable variant labels (see Section 5.2, "Common LGR" in [LGR-3]).

Overview

This document, together with the set of element LGRs, specifies an integrated set of Label Generation Rules for the Root Zone. For more details on the Root Zone LGRs and their development see "Root Zone Label Generation Rules - LGR-3: Overview and Summary [LGR-3]. The format of this file follows [RFC 7940].

This version of the document and all associated files are released for Public Comment. Please see the announcement on the ICANN website for public comments on the Root Zone LGR-3 for details on how to submit comments.

Element LGRs

The Label Generation Rules for the Root Zone (LGR-3) are integrated from the following set of script-specific element LGRs:

  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Arabic Script (und-Arab) [101]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Devanagari Script (und-Deva) [102]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Ethiopic Script (und-Ethi) [103]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Georgian Script (und-Geor) [104]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Gujarati Script (und-Gujr) [105]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Gurmukhi Script (und-Guru) [106]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Hebrew Script (und-Hebr) [107]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Kannada Script (und-Knda) [108]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Khmer Script (und-Khmr) [109]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Lao Script (und-Laoo) [110]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Malayalam Script (und-Mlym) [111]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Oriya Script (und-Orya) [112]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Sinhala Script (und-Sinh) [113]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Tamil Script (und-Taml) [114]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Telugu Script (und-Telu) [115]
  • Root Zone Label Generation Rules for the Thai Script (und-Thai) [116]

Each element LGR represents in full the underlying, proposal for the script-based LGR, except for changes required by the integration process or for uniformity of presentation. See Section 3, "Integration and Contents of LGR-3" in [LGR-3].

Merged LGR

This merged LGR contains the union of the repertoire, variant mappings and Whole Label Evaluation (WLE) rules as described in the following sections. Data that are necessarily script-dependent, such as the type for variant mappings have been removed or replaced by default values.

When processing an applied for label, this merged LGR presents the complete data and specification needed for conflict checking with any existing label, independent of script, while each script-specific element LGR presents the complete data and specification to determine the validity and full set of allocatable variants for the label, when applied for under that script. See also Section 5, "Using the LGR" in [LGR-3].

Repertoire

The repertoire of the integrated Root Zone LGR is the cumulative repertoire of all the Element LGRs that have been integrated into this version. Those repertoires, in turn were developed based on [MSR-4], which is a subset of [Unicode 6.3].

As a Root Zone LGR, the repertoire includes neither digits nor the HYPHEN-MINUS.

For further details, see Section 3.2.1, "Repertoire" in [LGR-3].

Each code point or range is tagged with the script or scripts that the code point is used with, and a reference to the Unicode Standard in which the code point was first encoded, see "References" below. Some code points are also tagged with script-specific classifications. These tags have been prefixed with the Unicode script identifier.

Variants

The variant mappings in this LGR are the union of the non-reflexive variant mappings from all the Element LGRs that have been integrated into this version of the Root Zone LGR. Because the disposition of variant labels, for example as "allocatable", is specific to each script, information related to that cannot be expressed in the script-neutral context of this merged file. Instead, all merged variant mappings are labeled as "blocked" in this document as needed for conflict checking. See also Section 3.2.2, "Variants" in [LGR-3].

Context Rules for Variants: some of the variants defined in this LGR are "effective null variants", that is, some code points in the source map to "nothing" in the target with all other code points unchanged. (Because mappings are symmetric, it does not matter whether it is the forward or reverse mapping that maps to "null"). Such variants require a context rule to keep the variant set well behaved. Symmetry requires the same context rule for both forward and reverse mappings.

In other cases, the sequences or code points making up source and target are constrained by explicit context rules on the code points (or by implicit context rules defined for the adjacent code points). In such a case, any variants may require context rules that match the intersection between the effective contexts for both source and target; otherwise, a sequence might be considered valid in some variant label when it would not be valid in an equivalent context in an original label.

The specification of variants in the Root Zone LGR follows the guidelines in [RFC 8228].

Character Classes

This merged LGR includes the cumulative set of character classes from all the Element LGRs that have been integrated into this version of the Root Zone LGR. See Section 3.2.3, "Character Classes" in [LGR-3]. The names for any script-specific character classes have been prefixed with the Unicode script identifier.

Whole Label Evaluation (WLE) and Context Rules

This merged LGR includes the cumulative set of WLE and contextrules and actions from all the Element LGRs that have been integrated into this version of the Root Zone LGR. See Section 3.2.4, "Whole Label EvaluationRules (WLE)" [LGR-3]. See also the comments given for each rule or action.

Default Whole Label Evaluation Rules and Actions

The integrated LGR includes the set of required default WLE rules and actions applicable to the Root Zone and defined in [MSR-4]. They are marked with ⍟. These default rules include the restrictions defined in [RFC 5891] on placement of combining marks.

Script-specific WLE rules

The names for any script-specific rules have been prefixed with the Unicode script identifier.

Methodology and Contributors

The Root Zone Label Generation Rules - LGR-3 [LGR-3] were integrated by the Integration Panel [IP], from a set of proposals for script-based root zone LGRs developed by community-based Generation Panels [GPs] in an open process with multiple public consultations defined in [Procedure] and [Guidelines]. For more information on the methodology and contributors, see [LGR-3], in particular Section 2 "Process of Integration" and Section 8, "Contributors".

References

In the listing of the repertoire, references starting at [0] refer to Unicode Standard versions in which the corresponding code points were initially encoded. References [100] and above correspond to the script-specific LGRs that include the repertoire item. Repertoire items may have more than one reference.

In addition the following references are cited in this document:

[GPs]
Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN), "Generation Panels", https://community.icann.org/display/croscomlgrprocedure/Generation+Panels (Accessed on 20 Nov. 2015)
[Guidelines]
Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers, (ICANN),“Guidelines for Developing Script-Specific Label Generation Rules for Integration into the Root Zone LGR”. (Los Angeles, California: ICANN, December 2014), https://community.icann.org/download/attachments/43989034/Guidelines-for-LGR-2014-12-02.pdf
[IP]
Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers, (ICANN), "Integration Panel" https://community.icann.org/display/croscomlgrprocedure/Integration+Panel, (Accessed on 20 Nov. 2015)
[LGR-3]
Integration Panel, "Root Zone Label Generation Rules - LGR-3: Overview and Summary", 25 April 2019, https://www.icann.org/sites/default/files/lgr/lgr-3-overview-25apr19-en.pdf
[MSR-4]
Integration Panel, "Maximal Starting Repertoire - MSR-4: Overview and Rationale", 7 February 2019, https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/msr-4-overview-25jan19-en.pdf
[Procedure]
Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers, "Procedure to Develop and Maintain the Label Generation Rules for the Root Zone in Respect of IDNA Labels." (Los Angeles, California: ICANN, March, 2013) http://www.icann.org/en/resources/idn/variant-tlds/draft-lgr-procedure-20mar13-en.pdf
[Proposal-Arabic]
TF-AIDN, "Proposal for Arabic Script Root Zone LGR", 18 November 2015 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/arabic-lgr-proposal-18nov15-en.pdf
[Proposal-Devanagari]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Devanagari Script Root Zone LGR", 22 April 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-devanagari-lgr-22apr19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Ethiopic]
Ethiopic Script Generation Panel, "Proposal for Ethiopic Script Root Zone LGR", 17 May 2017 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-ethiopic-lgr-17may17-en.pdf
[Proposal-Georgian]
Georgian Script Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Georgian Script Root Zone LGR", 24 November 2016 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-georgian-lgr-24nov16-en.pdf
[Proposal-Gujarati]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Gujarati Script Root Zone LGR", 6 March 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-gujarati-lgr-06mar19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Gurmukhi]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Gurmukhi Script Root Zone LGR", 22 April 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-gurmukhi-lgr-22apr19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Hebrew]
Hebrew Generation Panel, "Proposal for a Hebrew Script Root Zone Label Generation Ruleset (LGR)", 24 April 2091 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-hebrew-lgr-24Apr2019-en.pdf
[Proposal-Kannada]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Kannada Script Root Zone LGR", 6 March 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-kannada-lgr-06mar19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Khmer]
Khmer Generation Panel, “Proposal for Khmer Script Root Zone Label Generation Rules (LGR)”, 15 August 2016 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-khmer-lgr-15aug16-en.pdf
[Proposal-Lao]
Lao Script Generation Panel, "Proposal for a Lao Script Root Zone LGR", 31 January 2017 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-lao-lgr-31jan17-en.pdf
[Proposal-Malayalam]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Malayalam Script Root Zone LGR", 22 April 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-malayalam-lgr-22apr19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Oriya]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Oriya Script Root Zone LGR", 6 March 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-oriya-lgr-06mar19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Sinhala]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Sinhala Script Root Zone LGR", 22 April 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-sinhala-lgr-22apr19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Tamil]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Tamil Script Root Zone LGR", 6 March 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-tamil-lgr-06mar19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Telugu]
Neo-Brahmi Generation Panel, "Proposal for the Telugu Script Root Zone LGR", 6 March 2019 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-telugu-lgr-06mar19-en.pdf
[Proposal-Thai]
The Generation Panel for the Thai Script LGR, "Proposal for the Thai Script Root Zone LGR", 25 May 2017 (PDF), https://www.icann.org/en/system/files/files/proposal-thai-lgr-25may17-en.pdf
[RFC 5891]
J. Klensin, "Internationalized Domain Names in Applications (IDNA): Protocol", RFC 5891, August 2010, https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc5891
[RFC 6365]
Hoffman, P. and J. Klensin, "Terminology Used in Internationalization in the IETF", BCP 166, RFC 6365, DOI 10.17487/RFC6365, September 2011, https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc6365
[RFC 7940]
Davies, K. and A. Freytag, "Representing Label Generation Rulesets Using XML", RFC 7940, August 2016, https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc7940
[RFC 8228]
A. Freytag, "Guidance on Designing Label Generation Rulesets (LGRs) Supporting Variant Labels", RFC 8228, August 2017, https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc8228
[Unicode 6.3]
The Unicode Consortium. The Unicode Standard, Version 6.3.0, (Mountain View, CA: The Unicode Consortium, 2013. ISBN 978-1-936213-08-5) http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.3.0/

For more details for references [100] and up and [0] and up refer to the Table of References below, as well as to [LGR-3].

var.comment: U+0622 ALEF WITH MADDA ABOVE is simplified to U+0627 ALEF in the Arabic language
U+0623 ALEF WITH HAMZA ABOVE is simplified to U+0627 ALEF in the Arabic language
U+0624 WAV WITH HAMZA ABOVE is simplified to U+0648 WAV in the Arabic language
U+0625 ALEF WITH HAMZA BELOW is simplified to U+0627 ALEF in the Arabic language
In the Arabic language, U+0647 HEH may be substituted for U+0629 TEH MARBUTA. [RFC 6365]

The two are visually identical and the same label could be typed using one or the other based on the set language settings and keyboard layout of a user. Labels in the Arabic language using U+0629 TEH MARBUTA in the final and isolated positions will be typed in other languages using U+06C3 TEH MARBUTA GOAL (Urdu, etc.) which is identical in isolated and has a variant glyph or identical glyph form in final position
Used interchangeably in Africa for languages using Western (African) orthography
Used interchangeably in Africa for languages using Western (African) orthography
The two have identical shapes in initial and medial positions and are used by different language communities to refer to the same letter
The two have similar (interchangeable) shapes in initial and medial positions and are used by different language communities to refer to the same letter
Used interchangeably in Africa for languages using Western (African) orthography

Labels in the Arabic language using U+0647 HEH in the final and isolated positions will be typed in other languages using U+06C1 HEH GOAL (Urdu, Pashto, Saraiki, etc.) which is identical in isolated and has a variant glyph or identical glyph form in final position
The two are visually identical and the same label could be typed using one or the other based on the set language settings and keyboard layout of a user
U+0672 ALEF WITH WAVY HAMZA ABOVE is simplified to U+0627 ALEF in the Kashmiri language
The two have similar (interchangeable) shapes in initial and medial positions and are used by different language communities to refer to the same letter
U+06AB KAF WITH RING interchangeably used in Pashto with U+06AF GAF
Iraqi Arabic uses U+06AF GAF, whereas Moroccan Arabic uses U+0763 KEHEH WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE
U+06C0 HEH WITH YEH ABOVE is simplified to U+0647 HEH in some languages (Kurdish)

This is not allocatable in either direction because, unlike the allocatable relationship between U+0647 HEH and U+0629 TEH MARBUTA due to variation in the Arabic language, Urdu and other languages using U+06C1 HEH GOAL do not exhibit such variation with U+06C3 TEH MARBUTA GOAL
U+06C2 HEH GOAL WITH HAMZA ABOVE is simplified to U+06C1 HEH GOAL in Urdu

class.name: Khmr-dependent-vowel-1
class.comment: Dependent Khmer vowels used with NIKAHIT

class.name: Khmr-dependent-vowel-2
class.comment: Dependent Khmer vowels used with REAHMUK

class.name: Khmr-dependent-vowel-3
class.comment: Dependent Khmer vowel used with TOANDAKHIAT

class.name: Mlym-L
class.comment: Any Malayalam consonant without any vowel sound

union.name: Thai-c-av-bv
union.comment: Any Thai consonant, vowel-above or vowel-below

union.name: Thai-ct
union.comment: Any Thai consonant or tone mark

union.name: Thai-ctaa
union.comment: Any Thai consonant, tone or sara-aa

rule.name: Common-leading-combining-mark
rule.comment: Default WLE rule matching labels with leading combining marks ⍟

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-kaf-keheh
rule.comment: WLE Rule 1: do not mix Arabic letters KAF and KEHEH in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-kaf-swash
rule.comment: WLE Rule 2: do not mix Arabic letters KAF and SWASH KAF in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-alef-maksura-farsi-yeh
rule.comment: WLE Rule 3: do not mix Arabic letters ALEF MAKSURA and FARSI YEH in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-heh-goal
rule.comment: WLE Rule 4: do not mix Arabic letters HEH and HEH GOAL in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-heh-goal-ae
rule.comment: WLE Rule 5: do not mix Arabic letters HEH GOAL and AE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-heh-ae
rule.comment: WLE Rule 6: do not mix Arabic letters HEH and AE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-heh-doachashmee
rule.comment: WLE Rule 7: do not mix Arabic letters HEH and HEH DOACHASHMEE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-teh-marbuta-goal
rule.comment: WLE Rule 8: do not mix Arabic letters TEH MARBUTA and FEH WITH DOT MOVED BELOW in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-noon-with-three-dots-above-yeh-with-three-dots-below
rule.comment: WLE Rule 9: do not mix Arabic letters NOON WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE and YEH WITH THREE DOTS BELOW in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-peh-noon-with-three-dots-above
rule.comment: WLE Rule 10: do not mix Arabic letters PEH and NOON WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-feh-with-dot-moved-below
rule.comment: WLE 11:do not mix Arabic letters FEH and FEH WITH DOT MOVED BELOW in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-qaf-with-dot-above
rule.comment: WLE Rule 12: do not mix Arabic letters QAF and QAF WITH DOT ABOVE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-feh-qaf-with-dot-above
rule.comment: WLE Rule 13: do not mix Arabic letters FEH and QAF WITH DOT ABOVE in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-kaf-with-ring-gaf
rule.comment: WLE Rule 14: do not mix Arabic letters KAF WITH RING and GAF in the same label

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-kaf-with-ring-keheh-with-three-dots-above
rule.comment: WLE Rule 15: do not mix Arabic letters KAF WITH RING and KEHEH WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE

rule.name: Arab-no-mix-gaf-keheh-with-three-dots-above
rule.comment: WLE Rule 16: do not mix Arabic letters GAF and KEHEH WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE in the same label

rule.name: Deva-follows-either-C1-V1-or-M1
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: Rule for Nukta which restricts its preceding characters

rule.name: Deva-follows-C-or-CN
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2, 3: Halant or matra characters can only be preceded by consonant or a nukta which is preceded by a consonant

rule.name: Deva-follows-V-or-C-or-N-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 4, 5, 6: Anusvara, Candrabindu or Visarga characters can only be preceded by either Vowel or Consonant or Nukta or matra

rule.name: Deva-preceded-by-H
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 7: A vowel is not allowed to follow an H

rule.name: Deva-followed-by-N
rule.comment: Section 6.4.1, Variant Context Rule for Nukta: Variant not to be generated when followed by Nukta.

rule.name: Deva-followed-by-V-C-or-end
rule.comment: Section 6.1.2, Variant to be generateed when followed by V or C (including RRA) or end of label

rule.name: Gujr-follows-specific-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: N must be preceded by a specific set of Cs

rule.name: Gujr-follows-C-or-N
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2: Halant must be preceded by C or N; WLE 5: M: must be preceded by C or N

rule.name: Gujr-follows-V-C-N-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3 and WLE 4: Visarga and Anusvara must be preceded by V, C, N or M

rule.name: Guru-follows-C1
rule.comment: Section 7.1. N: must be preceded by C1

rule.name: Guru-follows-C-or-N-and-precedes-C2
rule.comment: Section 7.2. H: must be preceded by C or N and followed by C2

rule.name: Guru-follows-C-or-N
rule.comment: Section 7.3. M: must be preceded by C or N

rule.name: Guru-follows-specific-V-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7.4. Bindi must be preceded by specific V or M

rule.name: Guru-follows-C-N-or-specific-V-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7.5. Tippi must be preceded by, C, N or specific V or M

rule.name: Guru-follows-C-N-or-specific-V-or-M-and-precedes-C3
rule.comment: Section 7.6. Addak must be preceded by C, N or specific V or M and followed by C3

rule.name: Knda-follows-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: H must be preceded by C; WLE 2: M must be preceded by C

rule.name: Knda-follows-C-V-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3: Anusvara must be preceded by C, V or M; WLE 4: Visarga must be preceded by C, V or M

rule.name: Knda-follows-H
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 5: V cannot be preceded by H

rule.name: Khmr-subscript-consonant
rule.comment: WLE Rule 2: allowable subscript consonant sequence

rule.name: Khmr-subscript-consonant-limit
rule.comment: WLE Rule 3: more than two subscript consonants

rule.name: Khmr-coeng-context
rule.comment: WLE Rule 4: checks for 17D2 and its surrounding code points

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant-robat-shifter
rule.comment: WLE Rule 5: makes sure that dependent vowel follows a consonant or a shifter or a robat

rule.name: Khmr-follows-series-two
rule.comment: WLE Rule 6: checks sequence for shifter 17C9 MUUSIKATOAN

rule.name: Khmr-follows-series-one
rule.comment: WLE Rule 7: checks sequence for shifter 17CA TRIISAP

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant
rule.comment: WLE Rule 8: checks if sign code point or subscript consonant follows a consonant

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant-shifter
rule.comment: WLE Rule 9: checks if 17D0 KHMER SIGN SAMYOKSANNYA follows a consonant or a shifter

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant-depvowel-1-shifter
rule.comment: WLE Rule 10: checks if 17C6 KHMER SIGN NIKAHIT follows a consonant or a dependent vowel-1 or a shifter

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant-depvowel-2-shifter
rule.comment: WLE Rule 11: checks if 17C7 KHMER SIGN REAHMUK follows a consonant or a dependent vowel-2 or a shifter

rule.name: Khmr-follows-series-three
rule.comment: WLE Rule 12: checks if 17CB KHMER SIGN BANTOC code point follows a series-three consonant

rule.name: Khmr-follows-consonant-or-vowel-i
rule.comment: WLE Rule 13: checks if 17CD KHMER SIGN TOANDAKHIAT follows a consonant or 17B7 KHMER VOWEL SIGN I (Dependent-vowel-3)

rule.name: Laoo-follows-consonant
rule.comment: WLE Rule 1: A semi-consonant must follow a consonant

rule.name: Laoo-precedes-consonant
rule.comment: WLE Rule 2: A vowel-before precedes a main consonant cluster

rule.name: Laoo-follows-main-consonant
rule.comment: WLE Rule 3: A vowel-above, and vowel-below follow a main consonant C

rule.name: Laoo-follows-C-tonemark-vabove
rule.comment: WLE Rule 4: A vowel-after follows a main consonant, tone-mark or vowel-above

rule.name: Laoo-consonant-cluster
rule.comment: Defining consonant cluster for WLE Rule 5

rule.name: Laoo-follows-vbefore-consonant-cluster
rule.comment: WLE Rule 5: The sequence U+0EB2 U+0EB0 follows a vowel before, and a consonant cluster

rule.name: Laoo-follows-C-vabove-vbelow
rule.comment: WLE Rule 6: A tone-mark follows a main consonant, vowel-above or vowel-below

rule.name: Laoo-follows-Cf
rule.comment: WLE Rule 7: The sign U+0ECC can only occur after final consonants

rule.name: Laoo-repetition-mark-limit
rule.comment: WLE Rule 8: The sign U+0EC6 can only occur 0 to 3 times at the end of the label

rule.name: Mlym-follows-C-or-0D41-or-0D7B
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: Rule 1: H must be preceded by C or U+0D41-or-U+0D7B

rule.name: Mlym-follows-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2: M must be preceded by C

rule.name: Mlym-follows-C-V-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3: B must be preceded by C, V or M and WLE 4: X must be preceded by C, V or M

rule.name: Mlym-follows-B-X-or-H
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 5: L cannot be preceded by B, X or H

rule.name: Mlym-begins-with-L
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 6: Label does not begin with L

rule.name: Mlym-follows-0D33
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 7. The character U+0D33 (ള) cannot immediately follow U+0D33 (ള), except as part of a defined sequence

rule.name: Mlym-follows-0D31
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 8. The character U+0D31 (റ) cannot immediately follow U+0D31 (റ), except as part of a defined sequence

rule.name: Mlym-reordrant-matra
rule.comment: Section 7: Reordrant Malayalam matras, including sequence U+0D4D U+0D30

rule.name: Mlym-followed-by-R
rule.comment: variant not defined if followed by reordrant matra

rule.name: Mlym-follows-0D33-0D4D-or-followed-by-0D4D-0D33-or-R
rule.comment: Section 6.1, V1: variant not defined if preceded by 0D33+Halant or followed by Halant+0D33 or R

rule.name: Mlym-follows-0D31-0D4D-or-followed-by-0D4D-0D31-or-R
rule.comment: Section 6.1, V2: variant not defined if preceded by 0D31+Halant or followed by Halant+0D31 or R

rule.name: Orya-follows-C1
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: N must be preceded by C1

rule.name: Orya-follows-V-C-N-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2: B must be preceded by V, C, N or M; WLE 3: X must be preceded by V, C, N or M; WLE 4: D must be preceded by V, C, N or M

rule.name: Orya-follows-C-or-N
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 5: H must be preceded by C or N; WLE 6: M must be preceded by C or N

rule.name: Sinh-follows-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: Halanta/Virama must be preceded by C

rule.name: Sinh-follows-C-or-J
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2: Matra must be preceded by C or J

rule.name: Sinh-follows-V-C-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3: Visarga must be preceded by V, C or M

rule.name: Sinh-follows-V-C-J-or-M
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 4: Anusvara (Bindu) must be preceded by V, C, J or M

rule.name: Sinh-followed-by-H-or-M
rule.comment: variants are undefined preceding a Halant or Matra

rule.name: Sinh-followed-by-B-X-H-or-M
rule.comment: variants are undefined preceding an Anusvara, Visarga, Halant or Matra

rule.name: Taml-follows-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1, 2: H and M must be preceded by C

rule.name: Taml-preceded-by-X
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3 , X cannot be preceded by X

rule.name: Taml-no-mix-sri-shri
rule.comment: Section 7: WLE 4: Two representations of 'Shri' cannot be mixed in the same label

rule.name: Telu-follows-C-except-Nasal-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 1: H must be preceded by a C; WLE 5: H cannot follow Nasal-C

rule.name: Telu-follows-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 2: M must be preceded by C

rule.name: Telu-follows-V-M-or-C
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 3: Visarga must be preceded by V, M or C; WLE 4: Anusvara must be preceded by V, M or C

rule.name: Telu-follows-H
rule.comment: Section 7, WLE 6: V cannot be preceded by H

rule.name: Thai-precedes-consonant
rule.comment: WLE 7.2: check if current cp is preceding a consonant

rule.name: Thai-follows-consonant
rule.comment: WLE 7.3: check if current cp is following a consonant

rule.name: Thai-between-consonant-and-ct
rule.comment: WLE 7.4: check if current cp is in between a consonant and either tone or consonant

rule.name: Thai-follow-consonant-tone-sara-aa
rule.comment: WLE 7.5: U+0E30 (THAI CHARACTER SARA A, ะ) can follow a consonant, a tone or U+0E32 (THAI CHARACTER SARA AA, า)

rule.name: Thai-follows-consonant-tone
rule.comment: WLE 7.6, 7.9: check if current cp is following a consonant or a tone

rule.name: Thai-follows-consonant-av-bv
rule.comment: WLE 7.7, 7.8: A tone-mark, THANTHAKHAT, NIKAHIT can only follow a consonant, above-vowel or below-vowel

action.comment: labels with leading combining marks are invalid ⍟
Section 7, WLE 6: Label does not begin with L
any variant label with a code point out of repertoire is invalid ⍟
do not mix two representations of 'Shri' in the same label
any label with more than two subscript consonants in a row is invalid
do not mix Arabic letters KAF and KEHEH in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters KAF and SWASH KAF in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters ALEF MAKSURA and FARSI YEH in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters HEH and HEH GOAL in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters HEH GOAL and AE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters HEH and AE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters HEH and HEH DOACHASHMEE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters TEH MARBUTA and FEH WITH DOT MOVED BELOW in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters NOON WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE and YEH WITH THREE DOTS BELOW in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters PEH and NOON WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters FEH and FEH WITH DOT MOVED BELOW in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters QAF and QAF WITH DOT ABOVE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters FEH and QAF WITH DOT ABOVE in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters KAF WITH RING and GAF in the same label
do not mix Arabic letters KAF WITH RING and KEHEH WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE
do not mix Arabic letters GAF and KEHEH WITH THREE DOTS ABOVE in the same label
any variant label containing blocked variants is blocked ⍟
variant labels with all variants allocatable are allocatable ⍟
catch all (default action) ⍟
